meanings.definition: To fail or fall behind in performance or progress.
meanings.sent1: The team was tanking in the game, unable to score any points.
meanings.sent2: The company started tanking after the new competitor entered the market.
meanings.sent3: The student's grades were tanking so badly, they needed a tutor.
meanings.sent4: The runner's energy was tanking as he approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The plant was tanking in the dry soil, wilting under the sun.

meanings.definition: To deliberately perform poorly in order to achieve a specific outcome.
meanings.sent1: The basketball team was tanking to secure a higher draft pick.
meanings.sent2: The employee was accused of tanking the project to prove a point.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was tanking the dish to keep his secret recipe safe.
meanings.sent4: The actor was tanking his performance to get out of the play.
meanings.sent5: The student was tanking the test to avoid being chosen for the competition.

meanings.sent1: The fish tanking in the living room needed cleaning.
meanings.sent2: She poured the water into the tanking to water the plants.
meanings.sent3: The juice spilled all over the tanking, making a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The tanking in the kitchen was filled with cooking oil.
meanings.sent5: The tanking on the farm stored rainwater for the dry season.
